info.headline: Flood Advisory issued January 28 at 8:10AM EST until January 29 at 1:00PM EST by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 1030 AM EST THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...Buncombe and Henderson counties in western North Carolina. * WHEN...Until 1030 AM EST. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas particularly near the French Broad River. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 810 AM EST, Due to heavy rainfall Saturday through early this morning, minor flooding developed in the advisory area, along the French Broad River. Isolated farmland flooding is likely occurring across the French Broad River Valley from Etowah downstream to Avery Creek upstream of the gauge site at Fletcher. - Flooding impacts will continue through midday today, but no additional rainfall is expected. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Arden, Mills River, Fletcher, Etowah, Mountain Home, Laurel Park, Asheville Airport, Avery Creek, Horse Shoe and Forge Mountain. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: In hilly terrain there are hundreds of low water crossings which are potentially dangerous in heavy rain. Do not attempt to cross flooded roads. Find an alternate route. When it is safe to do so, please report flooding or landslides threatening roads or property to the National Weather Service Greenville-Spartanburg by calling toll free, 1, 800, 2 6 7, 8 1 0 1, by posting on our Facebook page, or via Twitter using hashtag NWSGSP. Your message should describe the specific location where impacts occurred and the depth of flooding observed.
